Immunology.title: Potent neutralization of Marburg virus by a vaccine-elicited antibody
Immunology.summary: Nature, Published online: 12 November 2025;doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09868-1Potent neutralization of Marburg virus by a vaccine-elicited antibody
Immunology.abstract: Marburg virus (MARV) is a filovirus that causes a severe and often lethal hemorrhagic fever1,2. Despite the increasing frequency of MARV outbreaks, no vaccines or therapeutics are licensed for use in humans. Here, we designed mutations that improve the expression, thermostability, and immunogenicity of the prefusion MARV glycoprotein (GP) ectodomain trimer, which is the sole target of neutralizing antibodies and vaccines in development3–8. We discovered a fully human, pan-marburgvirus monoclonal antibody, MARV16, that broadly neutralizes all MARV isolates as well as Ravn virus and Dehong virus with 40 to 100-fold increased potency relative to previously described antibodies9. Moreover, MARV16 provides therapeutic protection in guinea pigs challenged with MARV. We determined a cryo-electron microscopy structure of MARV16-bound MARV GP showing that MARV16 recognizes a prefusion-specific epitope spanning GP1 and GP2, blocking receptor binding and preventing conformational changes required for viral entry. We further reveal the architecture of the MARV GP glycan cap, which shields the receptor binding site (RBS), underscoring architectural similarities with distantly related filovirus GPs. MARV16 and previously identified RBS-directed antibodies9–11 can bind MARV GP simultaneously. These antibody cocktails require multiple mutations to escape neutralization by both antibodies, paving the way for MARV therapeutics resilient to viral evolution. MARV GP stabilization along with the discovery of MARV16 advance prevention and treatment options for MARV.

Immunology.title_cn: 疫苗诱导抗体对马尔堡病毒的强效中和作用
Immunology.abstract_cn: 马尔堡病毒（MARV）是一种丝状病毒，可引起严重且常致命的出血热1,2。尽管马尔堡病毒疫情日益频繁，但目前尚无获批用于人类的疫苗或治疗药物。在本研究中，我们设计了突变，以提高融合前马尔堡病毒糖蛋白（GP）胞外域三聚体的表达、热稳定性和免疫原性，该三聚体是中和抗体和在研疫苗的唯一靶点3–8。我们发现了一种全人源、泛马尔堡病毒单克隆抗体MARV16，它能广谱中和所有马尔堡病毒分离株以及拉文病毒和德宏病毒，其效力比先前报道的抗体9提高了40至100倍。此外，MARV16在感染马尔堡病毒的豚鼠中提供了治疗性保护。我们解析了MARV16结合马尔堡病毒GP的冷冻电镜结构，结果显示MARV16识别一个跨越GP1和GP2的融合前特异性表位，从而阻断受体结合并阻止病毒进入所需的构象变化。我们进一步揭示了马尔堡病毒GP聚糖帽的结构，该聚糖帽可屏蔽受体结合位点（RBS），这突显了其与远缘丝状病毒GP在结构上的相似性。MARV16和先前鉴定的靶向RBS的抗体9–11可以同时结合马尔堡病毒GP。这些抗体组合需要多个突变才能逃避两种抗体的中和作用，为开发能够抵抗病毒进化的马尔堡病毒治疗药物铺平了道路。马尔堡病毒GP的稳定化以及MARV16的发现，推动了马尔堡病毒预防和治疗方案的进展。

Immunology.title: Spatial fibroblast niches define Crohn’s fistulae
Immunology.summary: Nature, Published online: 12 November 2025;doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09744-ySpatial transcriptomic analysis of cells in intestinal fistulae of patients with Crohn’s disease reveals the existence of specialized fistula-associated cell states with distinct signalling profiles and extracellular matrix architecture.
Immunology.abstract: Crohn’s disease often presents with fistulae, abnormal tunnels that connect the intestine to the skin or other organs. Despite their profound effect on morbidity, the molecular basis of fistula formation remains unclear, largely owing to the challenge of capturing intact fistula tracts and their inherent heterogeneity1–3. Here we construct a subcellular-resolution spatial atlas of 68 intestinal fistulae spanning diverse anatomical locations. We describe fistula-associated epithelial, immune and stromal cell states, revealing abnormal zonation of growth factors and morphogens linked to establishment of tunnelling anatomy. We identify fistula-associated stromal (FAS) fibroblasts, which are assembled in concentric layers: a proliferative, lumen-adjacent zone beneath neutrophil and macrophage-rich granulation tissue, an active lesion core of FAS cells and a quiescent, pro-fibrotic outer zone. We examine the architecture of the extracellular matrix in the fistula tract and demonstrate that FAS populations associate with distinct collagen structures, exhibiting properties ranging from proliferation, migration and extracellular matrix remodelling to dense collagen deposition and fibrosis. We define niches supporting epithelialization of fistula tunnels and a FAS-like population that is detected at the base of ulcers in non-penetrating Crohn’s disease. Our study demonstrates that common molecular pathways and cellular niches underpin fistulae across intestinal locations, revealing the cellular protagonists of fistula establishment and persistence. This resource will inform the development of model systems and interventions to mitigate aberrant fibroblast activity while preserving their regenerative properties in Crohn’s disease. Spatial transcriptomic analysis of cells in intestinal fistulae of patients with Crohn’s disease reveals the existence of specialized fistula-associated cell states with distinct signalling profiles and extracellular matrix architecture.
Immunology.authors_short: McGregor, Colleen et al., Simmons, Alison
Immunology.title_cn: 空间成纤维细胞生态位界定克罗恩病瘘管
Immunology.abstract_cn: 克罗恩病常伴有瘘管形成，即连接肠道与皮肤或其他器官的异常通道。尽管瘘管对患者发病率有深远影响，但其形成的分子基础仍不明确，这主要归因于获取完整瘘管组织以及其固有的异质性所面临的挑战。在本研究中，我们构建了涵盖不同解剖位置的68个肠道瘘管的亚细胞分辨率空间图谱。我们描述了与瘘管相关的上皮细胞、免疫细胞和基质细胞状态，揭示了与隧道状结构形成相关的生长因子和形态发生素的异常分区。我们鉴定出瘘管相关基质（FAS）成纤维细胞，它们呈同心层状排列：一个位于中性粒细胞和巨噬细胞丰富的肉芽组织下方、邻近管腔的增殖区，一个由FAS细胞组成的活跃病灶核心区，以及一个静止的、促纤维化的外层区。我们检查了瘘管中细胞外基质的结构，并证明FAS细胞群与独特的胶原结构相关，表现出从增殖、迁移、细胞外基质重塑到致密胶原沉积和纤维化等多种特性。我们定义了支持瘘管隧道上皮化的生态位，并在非穿透性克罗恩病溃疡底部检测到一种FAS样细胞群。我们的研究表明，共同的分子通路和细胞生态位是肠道不同部位瘘管形成的基础，揭示了瘘管建立和持续存在的细胞主角。对克罗恩病患者肠道瘘管细胞进行空间转录组分析，揭示了具有独特信号传导特征和细胞外基质结构的特异性瘘管相关细胞状态的存在。这一资源将为开发模型系统和干预措施提供信息，以减轻异常成纤维细胞的活性，同时保留其在克罗恩病中的再生特性。

Immunology.title: SIGLEC12 mediates plasma membrane rupture during necroptotic cell death
Immunology.summary: Nature, Published online: 12 November 2025;doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09741-1CRISPR–Cas9-based genome-wide screening shows that SIGLEC12 mediates plasma membrane rupture in cells undergoing necroptosis, possibly through a human-specific mechanism, indicating its potential as a therapeutic target.
Immunology.abstract: Necroptosis is a form of lytic cell death that is overactivated during infections and in inflammatory pathologies1. NINJ1 was recently found to be a mediator of plasma membrane rupture (PMR) during pyroptosis, toxin-induced necrosis, apoptosis, and ferroptosis2,3, but the mediator of PMR during necroptotic cell death remained unknown. Here, using a CRISPR–Cas9-based genome-wide knockout approach, we identify SIGLEC12 as a key mediator of necroptosis downstream of MLKL at the PMR step. Cells with knockdown or knockout of SIGLEC12 are defective in necroptosis-induced PMR and demonstrate ballooning morphology. During necroptosis, SIGLEC12 undergoes dephosphorylation, interacts with MLKL, forms cytosolic puncta and assembles into fibrils. Notably, SIGLEC12 is cleaved by TMPRSS4 during necroptosis to produce a 20-kDa fragment highly homologous to NINJ1, and this cleavage event is required and sufficient to induce PMR during necroptosis. A SIGLEC12 variant associated with cancer (Ser458Phe) and a variant found in the general human population (Arg528Trp) attenuate SIGLEC12 cleavage by TMPRSS4. Knockout of Siglec12 in mouse cells does not affect PMR, suggesting a species-specific role. Our identification of SIGLEC12 as a mediator of PMR expands our understanding of how programmed necrosis is executed and offers new approaches for targeting this proinflammatory form of cell death in human diseases. CRISPR–Cas9-based genome-wide screening shows that SIGLEC12 mediates plasma membrane rupture in cells undergoing necroptosis, possibly through a human-specific mechanism, indicating its potential as a therapeutic target.
Immunology.authors_short: Noh, Hyunjin et al., Najafov, Ayaz
Immunology.title_cn: SIGLEC12介导坏死性凋亡过程中的质膜破裂
Immunology.abstract_cn: 坏死性凋亡是一种裂解性细胞死亡形式，在感染和炎症性病理过程中会过度激活。最近发现NINJ1是焦亡、毒素诱导的坏死、凋亡和铁死亡过程中质膜破裂（PMR）的介质，但坏死性凋亡过程中PMR的介质仍不清楚。本研究中，我们利用CRISPR-Cas9基因组范围敲除方法，鉴定出SIGLEC12是MLKL下游、坏死性凋亡PMR步骤的关键介质。SIGLEC12敲低或敲除的细胞在坏死性凋亡诱导的PMR中存在缺陷，并表现出气球状形态。在坏死性凋亡过程中，SIGLEC12发生去磷酸化，与MLKL相互作用，形成胞质斑点并组装成纤维。值得注意的是，在坏死性凋亡过程中，SIGLEC12被TMPRSS4裂解，产生一个与NINJ1高度同源的20 kDa片段，并且该裂解事件是诱导坏死性凋亡PMR的必要且充分条件。与癌症相关的SIGLEC12变体（Ser458Phe）和在普通人群中发现的变体（Arg528Trp）均能减弱TMPRSS4对SIGLEC12的裂解。小鼠细胞中Siglec12的敲除不影响PMR，这表明其具有物种特异性作用。我们将SIGLEC12鉴定为PMR的介质，这扩展了我们对程序性坏死执行机制的理解，并为在人类疾病中靶向这种促炎性细胞死亡形式提供了新方法。基于CRISPR-Cas9的基因组范围筛选表明，SIGLEC12在经历坏死性凋亡的细胞中介导质膜破裂，可能通过一种人类特异性机制，这预示着其作为治疗靶点的潜力。

Immunology.title: Non-apoptotic caspase-8 is critical for orchestrating exaggerated inflammation during severe SARS-CoV-2 infection
Immunology.summary: Nature Communications, Published online: 13 November 2025;doi:10.1038/s41467-025-65098-zDuring SARS-CoV-2 infection caspase-8 fuels harmful inflammation independent of apoptosis. Genetic loss of caspase-8 reduces cytokine levels, lowers viral load and mitigates disease severity, revealing non-apoptotic caspase-8 as a key driver of severe COVID-19.
Immunology.abstract: Inflammation and excess cytokine release are hallmarks of severe COVID-19. While programmed cell death is known to drive inflammation, its role in SARS-CoV-2 pathogenesis remains unclear. Using gene-targeted murine COVID-19 models, we here find that caspase-8 is critical for cytokine release and inflammation. Loss of caspase-8 reduces disease severity and viral load in mice, and this occurs independently of its apoptotic function. Instead, reduction in SARS-CoV-2 pathology is linked to decreased IL-1β levels and inflammation. Loss of pyroptosis and necroptosis mediators in gene-targeted animals provides no additional benefits in mitigating disease outcomes beyond that conferred by loss of caspase-8. Spatial transcriptomic and proteomic analyses of caspase-8-deficient mice confirm that improved outcomes are due to reduced pro-inflammatory responses, rather than changes in cell death signalling. Elevated expression of caspase-8 and cFLIP in infected lungs, alongside caspase-8-mediated cleavage of N4BP1, a suppressor of NF-kB signalling, indicates a role of this signalling axis in pathological inflammation. Collectively, these findings highlight non-apoptotic functions of caspase-8 as a driver of severe COVID-19 through modulation of inflammation, not through the induction of apoptosis. During SARS-CoV-2 infection caspase-8 fuels harmful inflammation independent of apoptosis. Genetic loss of caspase-8 reduces cytokine levels, lowers viral load and mitigates disease severity, revealing non-apoptotic caspase-8 as a key driver of severe COVID-19.
Immunology.authors_short: M. Bader, Stefanie et al., Doerflinger, Marcel
Immunology.title_cn: 非凋亡性Caspase-8在严重SARS-CoV-2感染中介导过度炎症的关键作用
Immunology.abstract_cn: 炎症和过度的细胞因子释放是重症COVID-19的标志。尽管已知程序性细胞死亡会驱动炎症，但其在SARS-CoV-2发病机制中的作用仍不清楚。本研究利用基因靶向小鼠COVID-19模型发现，Caspase-8对细胞因子释放和炎症至关重要。Caspase-8的缺失可降低小鼠的疾病严重程度和病毒载量，且这一过程独立于其凋亡功能。相反，SARS-CoV-2病理的减轻与IL-1β水平和炎症的降低有关。在基因靶向动物中，焦亡和坏死性凋亡介质的缺失在减轻疾病结局方面并未提供超出Caspase-8缺失所带来的额外益处。对Caspase-8缺陷小鼠进行空间转录组学和蛋白质组学分析证实，改善的结局是由于促炎反应的减少，而非细胞死亡信号传导的变化。感染肺中Caspase-8和cFLIP的表达升高，以及Caspase-8介导的N4BP1（一种NF-kB信号传导抑制剂）的裂解，表明该信号轴在病理性炎症中发挥作用。总而言之，这些发现强调了Caspase-8的非凋亡功能是重症COVID-19的关键驱动因素，它通过调节炎症而非诱导凋亡来促进疾病进展。在SARS-CoV-2感染期间，Caspase-8独立于凋亡驱动有害炎症，其基因缺失可降低细胞因子水平、减少病毒载量并减轻疾病严重程度。

Immunology.title: TSLP links intestinal nutrient sensing with amplification of the ILC2–tuft cell circuit
Immunology.summary: Nature Immunology, Published online: 12 November 2025;doi:10.1038/s41590-025-02328-yLocksley and colleagues describe a nutrient-sensing circuit in the small intestine. Upon feeding, TSLP production from fibroblasts is increased in a GLP-2-dependent manner, resulting in increased ILC2 activation and tuft cell hyperplasia, thus linking food intake with ILC2 activation.
Immunology.abstract: Group 2 innate lymphocytes (ILC2s) are prevalent in small intestine but their role during homeostasis is unclear. Here we show that thymic stromal lymphopoietin (TSLP)—a cytokine implicated in ILC2 activation—is expressed constitutively in subepithelial fibroblasts, including telocytes and crypt-associated trophocytes, which are specialized fibroblasts necessary to sustain epithelial identity. Feeding increases TSLP and induces ILC2 type 2 cytokines that are attenuated by deletion of TSLP in fibroblasts or TSLP receptor on ILC2s. Both mouse and human intestinal fibroblasts express receptors for glucagon-like peptide-2 (GLP-2)—an intestinotrophic growth factor released by enteroendocrine cells following food intake. GLP-2 promotes intestinal TSLP in mouse and human intestinal fibroblasts, and TSLP-dependent ILC2 activation and tuft cell hyperplasia in mice, thus linking nutrient detection with ILC2-mediated amplification of the tuft cell chemosensory circuit that promotes epithelial surveillance of ingested cargo. Locksley and colleagues describe a nutrient-sensing circuit in the small intestine. Upon feeding, TSLP production from fibroblasts is increased in a GLP-2-dependent manner, resulting in increased ILC2 activation and tuft cell hyperplasia, thus linking food intake with ILC2 activation.
Immunology.authors_short: Liao, Chang et al., Locksley, Richard M.
Immunology.title_cn: TSLP连接肠道营养感知与ILC2-簇状细胞回路的放大
Immunology.abstract_cn: 2型固有淋巴细胞 (ILC2s) 在小肠中普遍存在，但它们在稳态中的作用尚不清楚。本研究表明，胸腺基质淋巴细胞生成素 (TSLP)——一种与ILC2活化相关的细胞因子——在包括间质细胞和隐窝相关滋养细胞在内的上皮下成纤维细胞中组成型表达。这些成纤维细胞是维持上皮细胞特性所必需的特化细胞。进食会增加TSLP的表达并诱导ILC2产生2型细胞因子，而通过删除成纤维细胞中的TSLP或ILC2上的TSLP受体可以减弱这种效应。小鼠和人肠道成纤维细胞均表达胰高血糖素样肽-2 (GLP-2) 的受体，GLP-2是一种在进食后由肠内分泌细胞释放的促肠生长因子。GLP-2促进小鼠和人肠道成纤维细胞中肠道TSLP的表达，并促进小鼠体内TSLP依赖的ILC2活化和簇状细胞增生，从而将营养检测与ILC2介导的簇状细胞化学感应回路的放大联系起来，该回路促进了上皮细胞对摄入物质的监测。Locksley及其同事描述了小肠中的一个营养感知回路。进食后，成纤维细胞产生的TSLP以GLP-2依赖的方式增加，导致ILC2活化和簇状细胞增生增加，从而将食物摄入与ILC2活化联系起来。

Drug Discovery.title: A large-scale human toxicogenomics resource for drug-induced liver injury prediction
Drug Discovery.summary: Nature Communications, Published online: 13 November 2025;doi:10.1038/s41467-025-65690-3Drug-induced liver injury is a major cause of patient harm, trial failures, and drug withdrawals. Here, the authors show that a toxicogenomics resource of 300 drugs enables the prediction of liver injury with 88% sensitivity at 100% specificity and reveals mechanisms for safer drug development.
Drug Discovery.abstract: Drug-Induced Liver Injury (DILI) remains one of the most critical challenges in drug development, causing patient safety concerns, clinical trial failures and drug withdrawals. We introduce ToxPredictor, a toxicogenomics framework combining RNA-seq data from primary human hepatocytes with pharmacokinetic data to predict dose-resolved DILI risks and safety margins. At its core is DILImap, an RNA-seq library tailored for DILI research, comprising 300 compounds at multiple concentrations. ToxPredictor achieves 88% sensitivity at 100% specificity in blind validation, outperforming state-of-the-art methods. It flagged recent phase III clinical failures, including Evobrutinib, TAK-875, and BMS-986142, overlooked by animal studies. Beyond prediction, ToxPredictor provides mechanistic insights into hepatotoxic pathways, enabling early de-risking and actionable safety decisions. Unlike single-endpoint readouts—even from 3D models—transcriptomics offers a multi-dimensional system-level view of hepatocyte responses, capable of detecting diverse DILI mechanisms not captured by conventional assays. Scalable, actionable, and integrated into a broader AI/ML drug discovery platform, this work establishes toxicogenomics as a promising tool for developing safer therapeutics and addressing one of the most pressing challenges in toxicology. Drug-induced liver injury is a major cause of patient harm, trial failures, and drug withdrawals. Here, the authors show that a toxicogenomics resource of 300 drugs enables the prediction of liver injury with 88% sensitivity at 100% specificity and reveals mechanisms for safer drug development.
Drug Discovery.authors_short: Bergen, Volker et al., Zamanighomi, Mahdi
Drug Discovery.title_cn: 一个用于药物性肝损伤预测的大规模人类毒理基因组学资源
Drug Discovery.abstract_cn: 药物性肝损伤（DILI）仍然是药物开发中最严峻的挑战之一，它导致患者安全问题、临床试验失败和药物撤市。我们引入了ToxPredictor，这是一个毒理基因组学框架，它结合了原代人肝细胞的RNA测序数据和药代动力学数据，以预测剂量依赖性的DILI风险和安全裕度。其核心是DILImap，一个为DILI研究量身定制的RNA测序文库，包含300种化合物在多个浓度下的数据。ToxPredictor在盲法验证中实现了88%的敏感性和100%的特异性，优于现有最先进的方法。它成功识别了近期被动物研究忽视的III期临床失败药物，包括Evobrutinib、TAK-875和BMS-986142。除了预测功能，ToxPredictor还提供了肝毒性通路的机制性见解，有助于早期去风险化和制定可操作的安全决策。与单终点读数（即使是来自3D模型）不同，转录组学提供了肝细胞反应的多维度系统级视图，能够检测传统检测方法无法捕获的多种DILI机制。这项工作具有可扩展性、可操作性，并已整合到一个更广泛的AI/ML药物发现平台中，它确立了毒理基因组学作为开发更安全疗法和解决毒理学中最紧迫挑战之一的有前景工具的地位。药物性肝损伤是导致患者伤害、试验失败和药物撤市的主要原因。本文作者展示了一个包含300种药物的毒理基因组学资源能够以88%的敏感性和100%的特异性预测肝损伤，并揭示了更安全药物开发的机制。

Drug Discovery.title: SynGFN: learning across chemical space with generative flow-based molecular discovery
Drug Discovery.summary: Nature Computational Science, Published online: 13 November 2025;doi:10.1038/s43588-025-00902-wA persistent gap from theoretical molecules to experimentally viable compounds has hindered the practical adoption of generative algorithms. This study proposes SynGFN as a bridge linking molecular design and synthesis, accelerating exploration and producing diverse, synthesizable, high-performance molecules.
Drug Discovery.abstract: In recent years, artificial intelligence has advanced the design–make–test–analyze cycle, transforming molecular discovery. Despite these advances, the compartmentalized approach to computer-aided molecular design and synthesis remains a critical bottleneck, limiting further optimization of the design–make–test–analyze cycle. Here, to this end, we introduce SynGFN, which models molecular design as a cascade of simulated chemical reactions, enabling the assembly of molecules from synthesizable building blocks. SynGFN features two key ingredients: (1) a hierarchically pretrained policy network that accelerates learning across diverse distributions of desirable molecules in chemical spaces, and (2) a multifidelity acquisition framework to alleviate the cost of reward evaluations. These technical developments collectively endow SynGFN with the capability to explore a chemical space up to an order of magnitude larger (measured in terms of #Circles) than that of other synthesis-aware generative models, while identifying the most diverse, synthesizable and high-performance molecules. We demonstrate SynGFN’s potential impacts by designing inhibitors for GluN1/GluN3A, a therapeutic target for neuropsychiatric disorders. A persistent gap from theoretical molecules to experimentally viable compounds has hindered the practical adoption of generative algorithms. This study proposes SynGFN as a bridge linking molecular design and synthesis, accelerating exploration and producing diverse, synthesizable, high-performance molecules.
Drug Discovery.authors_short: Zhu, Yuchen et al., Hsieh, Chang-Yu
Drug Discovery.title_cn: SynGFN：基于生成流的分子发现，实现跨化学空间学习
Drug Discovery.abstract_cn: 近年来，人工智能推动了“设计-合成-测试-分析”循环的发展，从而革新了分子发现领域。尽管取得了这些进展，但计算机辅助分子设计和合成的割裂方法仍然是一个关键瓶颈，限制了“设计-合成-测试-分析”循环的进一步优化。为此，我们引入了SynGFN，它将分子设计建模为一系列模拟化学反应，从而能够从可合成的构建块组装分子。SynGFN具有两个关键要素：(1) 一个分层预训练的策略网络，可加速在化学空间中多样化理想分子分布上的学习；(2) 一个多保真度采集框架，以减轻奖励评估的成本。这些技术发展共同赋予SynGFN探索比其他合成感知生成模型大一个数量级（以#Circles衡量）的化学空间的能力，同时识别出最多样化、可合成且高性能的分子。我们通过设计GluN1/GluN3A（一种神经精神疾病的治疗靶点）的抑制剂，展示了SynGFN的潜在影响。从理论分子到实验可行化合物之间长期存在的鸿沟阻碍了生成算法的实际应用。本研究提出SynGFN作为连接分子设计与合成的桥梁，加速了探索并生成了多样化、可合成且高性能的分子。

Drug Discovery.title: Human organoids as 3D in vitro platforms for drug discovery: opportunities and challenges
Drug Discovery.summary: Nature Reviews Drug Discovery, Published online: 12 November 2025;doi:10.1038/s41573-025-01317-yHuman organoids provide physiologically relevant, 3D models for studying disease mechanisms, drug efficacy and toxicity. This Review examines organoid generation methods, applications in preclinical drug discovery, and the regulatory and practical challenges that must be addressed for their integration into development pipelines.
Drug Discovery.abstract: Organoids are 3D structures derived from stem cells that recapitulate key architectural and functional aspects of the corresponding tissue. Compared with conventional 2D cell lines, human organoids provide experimental models that more closely reflect human physiology. Their ability to capture the complexity and heterogeneity of human tissues enables the study of disease mechanisms, drug efficacy and toxicity. When generated from patient material, organoids also allow the assessment of individual drug responses. In this Review, we explore the utility of organoids in drug discovery. We outline current methodologies for generating and maintaining organoids, examine their applications in disease modelling, drug screening and safety evaluation, and consider regulatory aspects and the challenges for their broader adoption in drug discovery. Human organoids provide physiologically relevant, 3D models for studying disease mechanisms, drug efficacy and toxicity. This Review examines organoid generation methods, applications in preclinical drug discovery, and the regulatory and practical challenges that must be addressed for their integration into development pipelines.
Drug Discovery.authors_short: Wang, Daisong et al., Clevers, Hans
Drug Discovery.title_cn: 人体类器官作为药物发现的三维体外平台：机遇与挑战
Drug Discovery.abstract_cn: 类器官是源自干细胞的三维结构，能够重现相应组织的关键结构和功能特征。与传统的二维细胞系相比，人体类器官提供了更接近人体生理学的实验模型。它们能够捕捉人体组织的复杂性和异质性，从而有助于疾病机制、药物疗效和毒性的研究。当从患者材料中生成时，类器官还允许评估个体药物反应。在本综述中，我们探讨了类器官在药物发现中的应用价值。我们概述了类器官生成和维持的当前方法，审视了它们在疾病建模、药物筛选和安全性评估中的应用，并考虑了监管方面以及它们在药物发现中更广泛应用所面临的挑战。人体类器官为研究疾病机制、药物疗效和毒性提供了生理学相关的三维模型。本综述考察了类器官的生成方法、在临床前药物发现中的应用，以及为将其整合到开发流程中必须解决的监管和实践挑战。

Drug Discovery.title: Uridine-sensitized screening identifies demethoxy-coenzyme Q and NUDT5 as regulators of nucleotide synthesis
Drug Discovery.summary: Nature Metabolism, Published online: 13 November 2025;doi:10.1038/s42255-025-01419-2A uridine-sensitized CRISPR-Cas9 screening identifies demethoxy-CoQ as an alternative electron acceptor in the absence of CoQ, and NUDT5 as a regulator of de novo pyrimidine synthesis via its interaction with PPAT.
Drug Discovery.abstract: Rapidly proliferating cells require large amounts of nucleotides, making nucleotide metabolism a widely exploited therapeutic target against cancer, autoinflammatory disorders and viral infections. However, regulation of nucleotide metabolism remains incompletely understood. Here, we reveal regulators of de novo pyrimidine synthesis. Using uridine-sensitized CRISPR-Cas9 screening, we show that coenzyme Q (CoQ) is dispensable for pyrimidine synthesis, in the presence of the demethoxy-CoQ intermediate as alternative electron acceptor. We further report that the ADP-ribose pyrophosphatase NUDT5 directly binds PPAT, the rate-limiting enzyme in purine synthesis, which inhibits its activity and preserves the phosphoribosyl pyrophosphate (PRPP) pool. In the absence of NUDT5, hyperactive purine synthesis exhausts the PRPP pool at the expense of pyrimidine synthesis, which promotes resistance to purine and pyrimidine nucleobase analogues. Of note, the interaction between NUDT5 and PPAT is disrupted by PRPP, highlighting an intricate allosteric regulation. Overall, our findings reveal a fundamental mechanism of nucleotide balance and position NUDT5 as a regulator of nucleobase analogue metabolism. A uridine-sensitized CRISPR-Cas9 screening identifies demethoxy-CoQ as an alternative electron acceptor in the absence of CoQ, and NUDT5 as a regulator of de novo pyrimidine synthesis via its interaction with PPAT.
Drug Discovery.authors_short: Strefeler, Abigail et al., Jourdain, Alexis A.
Drug Discovery.title_cn: 尿苷敏感性筛选鉴定出脱甲氧基辅酶Q和NUDT5为核苷酸合成的调控因子
Drug Discovery.abstract_cn: 快速增殖的细胞需要大量的核苷酸，这使得核苷酸代谢成为癌症、自身炎症性疾病和病毒感染的广泛利用的治疗靶点。然而，核苷酸代谢的调控机制仍未完全阐明。在此，我们揭示了从头嘧啶合成的调控因子。通过尿苷敏感性CRISPR-Cas9筛选，我们发现，在脱甲氧基辅酶Q中间体作为替代电子受体存在的情况下，辅酶Q (CoQ) 对于嘧啶合成并非必需。我们进一步报告，ADP-核糖焦磷酸酶NUDT5直接结合嘌呤合成的限速酶PPAT，从而抑制其活性并维持磷酸核糖焦磷酸 (PRPP) 库。在NUDT5缺失的情况下，过度活跃的嘌呤合成会耗尽PRPP库，从而牺牲嘧啶合成，并促进对嘌呤和嘧啶核碱基类似物的耐药性。值得注意的是，NUDT5和PPAT之间的相互作用被PRPP破坏，这突显了一种复杂的变构调控机制。总而言之，我们的研究结果揭示了核苷酸平衡的基本机制，并将NUDT5定位为核碱基类似物代谢的调控因子。尿苷敏感性CRISPR-Cas9筛选鉴定出脱甲氧基辅酶Q在CoQ缺失时作为替代电子受体，并揭示NUDT5通过与PPAT的相互作用调控从头嘧啶合成。

Drug Discovery.title: Reawakening cAMP signalling in cancer cachexia
Drug Discovery.summary: Nature Metabolism, Published online: 12 November 2025;doi:10.1038/s42255-025-01417-4The question of why muscle wasting persists in cancer cachexia despite adequate nutrition has long since intrigued researchers. Here, the authors identify PDE4D-mediated suppression of cAMP–PKA–CREB1 signalling as a driver of mitochondrial dysfunction and show that PDE4D inhibition preserves muscle bioenergetics and mass in cancer cachexia.
Drug Discovery.abstract: The question of why muscle wasting persists in cancer cachexia despite adequate nutrition has long since intrigued researchers. Here, the authors identify PDE4D-mediated suppression of cAMP–PKA–CREB1 signalling as a driver of mitochondrial dysfunction and show that PDE4D inhibition preserves muscle bioenergetics and mass in cancer cachexia.
Drug Discovery.title_cn: 重新激活癌症恶病质中的cAMP信号传导
Drug Discovery.abstract_cn: 尽管营养充足，癌症恶病质中肌肉萎缩持续存在的原因长期以来一直困扰着研究人员。本研究中，作者们发现PDE4D介导的cAMP–PKA–CREB1信号传导抑制是线粒体功能障碍的驱动因素，并表明PDE4D抑制能够维持癌症恶病质中的肌肉生物能量和质量。

Drug Discovery.title: Impaired cAMP–PKA–CREB1 signalling drives mitochondrial dysfunction in skeletal muscle during cancer cachexia
Drug Discovery.summary: Nature Metabolism, Published online: 12 November 2025;doi:10.1038/s42255-025-01397-5Tumour-induced dysregulation of cAMP–PKA–CREB1 signalling in skeletal muscle is shown to be a driver of mitochondrial dysfunction, contributing to cancer cachexia in mice.
Drug Discovery.abstract: Skeletal muscle wasting is a defining feature of cancer cachexia, a multifactorial syndrome that drastically compromises patient quality of life and treatment outcomes. Mitochondrial dysfunction is a major contributor to skeletal muscle wasting in cancer cachexia, yet the upstream molecular drivers remain elusive. Here we show that cancer impairs the activity of cAMP-dependent protein kinase A (PKA) and of its transcriptional effector CREB1 in skeletal muscle, ultimately contributing to the downregulation of a core transcriptional network that supports mitochondrial integrity and function. The restoration of cAMP–PKA–CREB1 signalling through pharmacological inhibition of the cAMP-hydrolysing phosphodiesterase 4 (PDE4) rescues the expression of mitochondrial-related genes, improves mitochondrial function and mitigates skeletal muscle wasting in male mice. Altogether, our data identify tumour-induced suppression of the cAMP–PKA–CREB1 axis as a central mechanism contributing to mitochondrial dysfunction in skeletal muscle during cancer cachexia. Furthermore, these findings highlight PDE4, particularly the PDE4D isoform, as a potential therapeutic target to preserve muscle mitochondrial function and counteract muscle wasting in cancer cachexia. Tumour-induced dysregulation of cAMP–PKA–CREB1 signalling in skeletal muscle is shown to be a driver of mitochondrial dysfunction, contributing to cancer cachexia in mice.
Drug Discovery.authors_short: Angelino, Elia et al., Graziani, Andrea
Drug Discovery.title_cn: 受损的cAMP–PKA–CREB1信号通路驱动癌症恶病质期间骨骼肌线粒体功能障碍
Drug Discovery.abstract_cn: 骨骼肌萎缩是癌症恶病质的一个典型特征，这是一种严重损害患者生活质量和治疗效果的多因素综合征。线粒体功能障碍是癌症恶病质中骨骼肌萎缩的主要原因之一，但其上游分子驱动因素仍不明确。本研究表明，癌症损害了骨骼肌中cAMP依赖性蛋白激酶A (PKA)及其转录效应因子CREB1的活性，最终导致支持线粒体完整性和功能的关键转录网络的下调。通过药理学抑制cAMP水解磷酸二酯酶4 (PDE4)来恢复cAMP–PKA–CREB1信号通路，可在雄性小鼠中挽救线粒体相关基因的表达，改善线粒体功能并减轻骨骼肌萎缩。总而言之，我们的数据表明肿瘤诱导的cAMP–PKA–CREB1轴抑制是导致癌症恶病质期间骨骼肌线粒体功能障碍的核心机制。此外，这些发现强调PDE4，特别是PDE4D亚型，是维持肌肉线粒体功能和对抗癌症恶病质中肌肉萎缩的潜在治疗靶点。研究表明，肿瘤诱导的骨骼肌中cAMP–PKA–CREB1信号通路的失调是线粒体功能障碍的驱动因素，并导致小鼠癌症恶病质。

Drug Discovery.title: Chemical richness and diversity of uncultivated ‘Entotheonella’ symbionts in marine sponges
Drug Discovery.summary: Nature Chemical Biology, Published online: 13 November 2025;doi:10.1038/s41589-025-02066-0Marine sponges host bacteria that produce diverse bioactive compounds. Here, the authors conduct a large-scale metagenomic, single-bacterial and biochemical study to reveal the untapped biosynthetic potential of ‘Entotheonella’ symbionts, a talented producer taxon from microbial dark matter.
Drug Discovery.abstract: Marine sponges are the source of numerous bioactive natural products that serve as chemical defenses and provide pharmaceutical leads for drug development. For some of the compounds, symbiotic bacteria have been established as the actual producers. Among the known sponge symbionts, ‘Candidatus Entotheonella’ members stand out because of their abundant and variable biosynthetic gene clusters (BGCs). Here, to obtain broader insights into this producer taxon, we conduct a comparative analysis on eight sponges through metagenomic and single-bacterial sequencing and biochemical studies. The data suggest sets of biosynthetic genes that are largely unique in 14 ‘Entotheonella’ candidate species and a member of a sister lineage named ‘Candidatus Proxinella’. Four biosynthetic loci were linked in silico or experimentally to cytotoxins, antibiotics and the terpene cembrene A from corals. The results support widespread and diverse bacterial roles in the chemistry of sponges and aid the development of sustainable production methods for sponge-derived therapeutics. Marine sponges host bacteria that produce diverse bioactive compounds. Here, the authors conduct a large-scale metagenomic, single-bacterial and biochemical study to reveal the untapped biosynthetic potential of ‘Entotheonella’ symbionts, a talented producer taxon from microbial dark matter.
Drug Discovery.authors_short: Dell, Maria et al., Piel, Jörn
Drug Discovery.title_cn: 海洋海绵中未培养的“Entotheonella”共生体的化学多样性与丰富性
Drug Discovery.abstract_cn: 海洋海绵是多种生物活性天然产物的来源，这些产物既可作为化学防御物质，也为药物开发提供了药学先导化合物。对于其中一些化合物，共生细菌已被证实是其真正的生产者。在已知的海绵共生体中，“Candidatus Entotheonella”成员因其丰富且多变的生物合成基因簇（BGCs）而脱颖而出。为了更深入地了解这一生产者类群，本研究通过宏基因组学、单细菌测序和生物化学研究，对八种海绵进行了比较分析。数据表明，在14种“Entotheonella”候选物种以及一个名为“Candidatus Proxinella”的姐妹谱系成员中，存在大量独特的生物合成基因集。四个生物合成位点通过计算机模拟或实验被证实与细胞毒素、抗生素以及来自珊瑚的萜烯类化合物cembrene A相关。这些结果支持了细菌在海绵化学中广泛而多样的作用，并有助于开发海绵源治疗药物的可持续生产方法。海洋海绵宿主细菌可产生多种生物活性化合物。本研究中，作者通过大规模宏基因组学、单细菌和生物化学研究，揭示了“Entotheonella”共生体（一个来自微生物暗物质的优秀生产者类群）尚未开发的生物合成潜力。

Microbiology.title: Potent neutralization of Marburg virus by a vaccine-elicited antibody
Microbiology.summary: Nature, Published online: 12 November 2025;doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09868-1Potent neutralization of Marburg virus by a vaccine-elicited antibody
Microbiology.abstract: Marburg virus (MARV) is a filovirus that causes a severe and often lethal hemorrhagic fever1,2. Despite the increasing frequency of MARV outbreaks, no vaccines or therapeutics are licensed for use in humans. Here, we designed mutations that improve the expression, thermostability, and immunogenicity of the prefusion MARV glycoprotein (GP) ectodomain trimer, which is the sole target of neutralizing antibodies and vaccines in development3–8. We discovered a fully human, pan-marburgvirus monoclonal antibody, MARV16, that broadly neutralizes all MARV isolates as well as Ravn virus and Dehong virus with 40 to 100-fold increased potency relative to previously described antibodies9. Moreover, MARV16 provides therapeutic protection in guinea pigs challenged with MARV. We determined a cryo-electron microscopy structure of MARV16-bound MARV GP showing that MARV16 recognizes a prefusion-specific epitope spanning GP1 and GP2, blocking receptor binding and preventing conformational changes required for viral entry. We further reveal the architecture of the MARV GP glycan cap, which shields the receptor binding site (RBS), underscoring architectural similarities with distantly related filovirus GPs. MARV16 and previously identified RBS-directed antibodies9–11 can bind MARV GP simultaneously. These antibody cocktails require multiple mutations to escape neutralization by both antibodies, paving the way for MARV therapeutics resilient to viral evolution. MARV GP stabilization along with the discovery of MARV16 advance prevention and treatment options for MARV.
Microbiology.authors_short: Addetia, Amin et al., Veesler, David
Microbiology.title_cn: 疫苗诱导抗体对马尔堡病毒的强效中和作用
Microbiology.abstract_cn: 马尔堡病毒（MARV）是一种丝状病毒，可引起严重且常致命的出血热1,2。尽管马尔堡病毒疫情日益频繁，但目前尚无获批用于人类的疫苗或治疗药物。在本研究中，我们设计了突变，以提高融合前马尔堡病毒糖蛋白（GP）胞外域三聚体的表达、热稳定性和免疫原性，该三聚体是中和抗体和在研疫苗的唯一靶点3–8。我们发现了一种全人源、泛马尔堡病毒单克隆抗体MARV16，它能广谱中和所有马尔堡病毒分离株以及拉文病毒和德宏病毒，其效力比先前报道的抗体9提高了40至100倍。此外，MARV16在感染马尔堡病毒的豚鼠中提供了治疗性保护。我们解析了MARV16结合马尔堡病毒GP的冷冻电镜结构，结果显示MARV16识别一个跨越GP1和GP2的融合前特异性表位，从而阻断受体结合并阻止病毒进入所需的构象变化。我们进一步揭示了马尔堡病毒GP聚糖帽的结构，该聚糖帽可屏蔽受体结合位点（RBS），这突显了其与远缘丝状病毒GP在结构上的相似性。MARV16和先前鉴定的靶向RBS的抗体9–11可以同时结合马尔堡病毒GP。这些抗体组合需要多个突变才能逃避两种抗体的中和作用，为开发能够抵抗病毒进化的马尔堡病毒治疗药物铺平了道路。马尔堡病毒GP的稳定化以及MARV16的发现，推动了马尔堡病毒预防和治疗方案的进展。

Microbiology.title: Ecology and spread of the North American H5N1 epizootic
Microbiology.summary: Nature, Published online: 12 November 2025;doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09737-xThe panzootic of highly pathogenic H5N1 since 2021 was driven by around nine introductions into the Atlantic and Pacific flyways, followed by rapid dissemination through wild migratory birds, primarily Anseriformes.
Microbiology.abstract: Since late 2021, a panzootic of highly pathogenic H5N1 has devastated wild birds, agriculture and mammals. Here an analysis of 1,818 haemagglutinin sequences from wild birds, domestic birds and mammals reveals that the North American panzootic was driven by around nine introductions into the Atlantic and Pacific flyways, followed by rapid dissemination through wild, migratory birds. Transmission was primarily driven by Anseriformes, while non-canonical species acted as dead-end hosts. In contrast to the epizootic of 2015 (refs. 1,2), outbreaks in domestic birds were driven by around 46–113 independent introductions from wild birds that persisted for up to 6 months. Backyard birds were infected around 9 days earlier on average than commercial poultry, suggesting potential as early-warning signals for transmission upticks. We pinpoint wild birds as critical drivers of the epizootic, implying that enhanced surveillance in wild birds and strategies that reduce transmission at the wild–agriculture interface will be key for future tracking and outbreak prevention. The panzootic of highly pathogenic H5N1 since 2021 was driven by around nine introductions into the Atlantic and Pacific flyways, followed by rapid dissemination through wild migratory birds, primarily Anseriformes.
Microbiology.authors_short: Damodaran, Lambodhar et al., Moncla, Louise H.
Microbiology.title_cn: 北美H5N1动物流行病的生态学与传播
Microbiology.abstract_cn: 自2021年末以来，高致病性H5N1的全球性动物疫情（panzootic）已对野生鸟类、农业和哺乳动物造成了严重破坏。本研究通过分析来自野生鸟类、家禽和哺乳动物的1,818个血凝素序列，揭示了北美洲的H5N1大流行是由大约九次引入大西洋和太平洋迁徙路线所驱动的，随后通过野生候鸟迅速传播。传播主要由雁形目鸟类驱动，而非典型物种则充当了终末宿主。与2015年的动物流行病（参考文献1,2）相比，家禽疫情是由来自野生鸟类的大约46-113次独立引入所驱动的，这些引入持续了长达6个月。平均而言，庭院饲养的禽鸟比商业家禽早约9天被感染，这表明它们可能作为传播上升的早期预警信号。我们指出野生鸟类是此次动物流行病的关键驱动因素，这意味着加强对野生鸟类的监测以及在野生动物-农业界面减少传播的策略，将是未来追踪和预防疫情的关键。自2021年以来，高致病性H5N1的全球性动物疫情是由大约九次引入大西洋和太平洋迁徙路线所驱动的，随后通过野生候鸟（主要是雁形目鸟类）迅速传播。

Microbiology.title: Viral NblA proteins negatively affect oceanic cyanobacterial photosynthesis
Microbiology.summary: Nature, Published online: 12 November 2025;doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09656-xViral NblA accelerates the cyanophage infection cycle, directs degradation of the host phycobilisome and other proteins, and reduces host photosynthetic light-harvesting efficiency.
Microbiology.abstract: Marine picocyanobacteria are abundant photosynthetic organisms of global importance. They coexist in the ocean with cyanophages—viruses that infect cyanobacteria. Cyanophages carry many auxiliary metabolic genes acquired from their hosts that are thought to redirect host metabolism for the phage’s benefit1–5. One such gene is nblA, which is present in multiple cyanophage families2,6–8. Under nutrient deprivation cyanobacterial NblA is responsible for inducing proteolytic degradation of the phycobilisome9–11, the large cyanobacterial photosynthetic light-harvesting complex. This increases the pool of amino acids available for essential tasks11, serving as a survival mechanism12. Ectopic expression of different cyanophage nblA genes results in host pigment protein degradation6,8,13. However, the benefit of the virus-encoded NblA for cyanophages and the broader impact on the host are unclear. Here, using a recently developed genetic manipulation system for marine cyanophages14, we reveal that viral NblA significantly accelerates the cyanophage infection cycle, directs degradation of the host phycobilisome and other proteins, and reduces host photosynthetic light-harvesting efficiency. Metagenomic analysis revealed that cyanophages carrying nblA are widespread in the oceans and comprise 35% and 65% of oceanic T7-like cyanophages in surface and deep photic zones, respectively. Our results show a large benefit of NblA to the cyanophage, while it exerts a negative effect on the host photosynthetic apparatus and host photosynthesis. These findings suggest that cyanophage NblA has an adverse global impact on light harvesting by oceanic picocyanobacteria. Viral NblA accelerates the cyanophage infection cycle, directs degradation of the host phycobilisome and other proteins, and reduces host photosynthetic light-harvesting efficiency.
Microbiology.authors_short: Nadel, Omer et al., Lindell, Debbie
Microbiology.title_cn: 病毒NblA蛋白负面影响海洋蓝细菌光合作用
Microbiology.abstract_cn:
海洋微型蓝细菌是全球重要的光合生物。它们与感染蓝细菌的噬蓝细菌病毒（cyanophages）共存于海洋中。噬蓝细菌病毒携带许多从宿主处获得的辅助代谢基因，这些基因被认为能重定向宿主代谢以利于病毒自身1–5。nblA是其中一个基因，它存在于多个噬蓝细菌病毒家族中2,6–8。在营养匮乏条件下，蓝细菌的NblA负责诱导藻胆体（大型蓝细菌光合捕光复合物）的蛋白水解降解9–11。这增加了可用于基本任务的氨基酸库11，作为一种生存机制12。不同噬蓝细菌病毒nblA基因的异位表达会导致宿主色素蛋白降解6,8,13。然而，病毒编码的NblA对噬蓝细菌病毒的益处以及对宿主的更广泛影响尚不清楚。

本研究利用最近开发的海洋噬蓝细菌病毒基因操作系统14，揭示了病毒NblA显著加速了噬蓝细菌病毒感染周期，引导宿主藻胆体及其他蛋白质的降解，并降低了宿主光合捕光效率。宏基因组分析显示，携带nblA的噬蓝细菌病毒在海洋中广泛分布，分别占表层和深层透光区海洋T7样噬蓝细菌病毒的35%和65%。我们的结果表明，NblA对噬蓝细菌病毒有显著益处，同时对宿主光合作用装置和宿主光合作用产生负面影响。这些发现提示，噬蓝细菌病毒NblA对海洋微型蓝细菌的光捕获具有不利的全球性影响。病毒NblA通过加速噬蓝细菌病毒感染周期、引导宿主藻胆体及其他蛋白质降解，并降低宿主光合捕光效率来发挥作用。

Microbiology.title: Non-apoptotic caspase-8 is critical for orchestrating exaggerated inflammation during severe SARS-CoV-2 infection
Microbiology.summary: Nature Communications, Published online: 13 November 2025;doi:10.1038/s41467-025-65098-zDuring SARS-CoV-2 infection caspase-8 fuels harmful inflammation independent of apoptosis. Genetic loss of caspase-8 reduces cytokine levels, lowers viral load and mitigates disease severity, revealing non-apoptotic caspase-8 as a key driver of severe COVID-19.
Microbiology.abstract: Inflammation and excess cytokine release are hallmarks of severe COVID-19. While programmed cell death is known to drive inflammation, its role in SARS-CoV-2 pathogenesis remains unclear. Using gene-targeted murine COVID-19 models, we here find that caspase-8 is critical for cytokine release and inflammation. Loss of caspase-8 reduces disease severity and viral load in mice, and this occurs independently of its apoptotic function. Instead, reduction in SARS-CoV-2 pathology is linked to decreased IL-1β levels and inflammation. Loss of pyroptosis and necroptosis mediators in gene-targeted animals provides no additional benefits in mitigating disease outcomes beyond that conferred by loss of caspase-8. Spatial transcriptomic and proteomic analyses of caspase-8-deficient mice confirm that improved outcomes are due to reduced pro-inflammatory responses, rather than changes in cell death signalling. Elevated expression of caspase-8 and cFLIP in infected lungs, alongside caspase-8-mediated cleavage of N4BP1, a suppressor of NF-kB signalling, indicates a role of this signalling axis in pathological inflammation. Collectively, these findings highlight non-apoptotic functions of caspase-8 as a driver of severe COVID-19 through modulation of inflammation, not through the induction of apoptosis. During SARS-CoV-2 infection caspase-8 fuels harmful inflammation independent of apoptosis. Genetic loss of caspase-8 reduces cytokine levels, lowers viral load and mitigates disease severity, revealing non-apoptotic caspase-8 as a key driver of severe COVID-19.
Microbiology.authors_short: M. Bader, Stefanie et al., Doerflinger, Marcel
Microbiology.title_cn: 非凋亡性Caspase-8在严重SARS-CoV-2感染中介导过度炎症的关键作用
Microbiology.abstract_cn: 炎症和过度的细胞因子释放是重症COVID-19的标志。尽管已知程序性细胞死亡会驱动炎症，但其在SARS-CoV-2发病机制中的作用仍不清楚。本研究利用基因靶向小鼠COVID-19模型发现，Caspase-8对细胞因子释放和炎症至关重要。Caspase-8的缺失可降低小鼠的疾病严重程度和病毒载量，且这一过程独立于其凋亡功能。相反，SARS-CoV-2病理的减轻与IL-1β水平和炎症的降低有关。在基因靶向动物中，焦亡和坏死性凋亡介质的缺失在减轻疾病结局方面并未提供超出Caspase-8缺失所带来的额外益处。对Caspase-8缺陷小鼠进行空间转录组学和蛋白质组学分析证实，改善的结局是由于促炎反应的减少，而非细胞死亡信号传导的变化。感染肺中Caspase-8和cFLIP的表达升高，以及Caspase-8介导的N4BP1（一种NF-kB信号传导抑制剂）的裂解，表明该信号轴在病理性炎症中发挥作用。总而言之，这些发现强调了Caspase-8的非凋亡功能是重症COVID-19的关键驱动因素，它通过调节炎症而非诱导凋亡来促进疾病进展。在SARS-CoV-2感染期间，Caspase-8独立于凋亡驱动有害炎症，其基因缺失可降低细胞因子水平、减少病毒载量并减轻疾病严重程度。

Microbiology.title: Chemical richness and diversity of uncultivated ‘Entotheonella’ symbionts in marine sponges
Microbiology.summary: Nature Chemical Biology, Published online: 13 November 2025;doi:10.1038/s41589-025-02066-0Marine sponges host bacteria that produce diverse bioactive compounds. Here, the authors conduct a large-scale metagenomic, single-bacterial and biochemical study to reveal the untapped biosynthetic potential of ‘Entotheonella’ symbionts, a talented producer taxon from microbial dark matter.
Microbiology.abstract: Marine sponges are the source of numerous bioactive natural products that serve as chemical defenses and provide pharmaceutical leads for drug development. For some of the compounds, symbiotic bacteria have been established as the actual producers. Among the known sponge symbionts, ‘Candidatus Entotheonella’ members stand out because of their abundant and variable biosynthetic gene clusters (BGCs). Here, to obtain broader insights into this producer taxon, we conduct a comparative analysis on eight sponges through metagenomic and single-bacterial sequencing and biochemical studies. The data suggest sets of biosynthetic genes that are largely unique in 14 ‘Entotheonella’ candidate species and a member of a sister lineage named ‘Candidatus Proxinella’. Four biosynthetic loci were linked in silico or experimentally to cytotoxins, antibiotics and the terpene cembrene A from corals. The results support widespread and diverse bacterial roles in the chemistry of sponges and aid the development of sustainable production methods for sponge-derived therapeutics. Marine sponges host bacteria that produce diverse bioactive compounds. Here, the authors conduct a large-scale metagenomic, single-bacterial and biochemical study to reveal the untapped biosynthetic potential of ‘Entotheonella’ symbionts, a talented producer taxon from microbial dark matter.
Microbiology.authors_short: Dell, Maria et al., Piel, Jörn
Microbiology.title_cn: 海洋海绵中未培养的“Entotheonella”共生体的化学多样性与丰富性
Microbiology.abstract_cn: 海洋海绵是多种生物活性天然产物的来源，这些产物既可作为化学防御物质，也为药物开发提供了药学先导化合物。对于其中一些化合物，共生细菌已被证实是其真正的生产者。在已知的海绵共生体中，“Candidatus Entotheonella”成员因其丰富且多变的生物合成基因簇（BGCs）而脱颖而出。为了更深入地了解这一生产者类群，本研究通过宏基因组学、单细菌测序和生物化学研究，对八种海绵进行了比较分析。数据表明，在14种“Entotheonella”候选物种以及一个名为“Candidatus Proxinella”的姐妹谱系成员中，存在大量独特的生物合成基因集。四个生物合成位点通过计算机模拟或实验被证实与细胞毒素、抗生素以及来自珊瑚的萜烯类化合物cembrene A相关。这些结果支持了细菌在海绵化学中广泛而多样的作用，并有助于开发海绵源治疗药物的可持续生产方法。海洋海绵宿主细菌可产生多种生物活性化合物。本研究中，作者通过大规模宏基因组学、单细菌和生物化学研究，揭示了“Entotheonella”共生体（一个来自微生物暗物质的优秀生产者类群）尚未开发的生物合成潜力。

Microbiology.title: Bin Chicken: targeted metagenomic coassembly for the efficient recovery of novel genomes
Microbiology.summary: Nature Methods, Published online: 13 November 2025;doi:10.1038/s41592-025-02901-1By developing a strategy of metagenomic coassembly and prioritizing divergent marker gene sequences, Bin Chicken efficiently recovers more than 77,000 microbial genomes with high novel diversity, thereby expanding the tree of life.
Microbiology.abstract: The recovery of microbial genomes from metagenomic datasets has provided genomic representation for hundreds of thousands of species from diverse biomes. However, low-abundance microorganisms are often missed due to insufficient genomic coverage. Here we present Bin Chicken, an algorithm that substantially improves genome recovery through automated, targeted selection of metagenomes for coassembly based on shared marker gene sequences derived from raw reads. Marker gene sequences that are divergent from known reference genomes can be further prioritized, providing an efficient means of recovering highly novel genomes. Applying Bin Chicken to public metagenomes and coassembling 800 sample groups recovered 77,562 microbial genomes, including the first genomic representatives of 6 phyla, 41 classes and 24,028 species. These genomes expand the genomic tree of life and uncover a wealth of novel microbial lineages for further research. By developing a strategy of metagenomic coassembly and prioritizing divergent marker gene sequences, Bin Chicken efficiently recovers more than 77,000 microbial genomes with high novel diversity, thereby expanding the tree of life.
Microbiology.authors_short: Aroney, Samuel T. N. et al., Woodcroft, Ben J.
Microbiology.title_cn: Bin Chicken：靶向宏基因组共组装用于高效恢复新型基因组
Microbiology.abstract_cn: 从宏基因组数据集中恢复微生物基因组，为来自不同生物群落的数十万物种提供了基因组代表。然而，由于基因组覆盖度不足，低丰度微生物常常被遗漏。本文介绍了一种名为 Bin Chicken 的算法，该算法通过基于原始测序读段中共享的标记基因序列，自动、靶向选择宏基因组进行共组装，从而显著提高了基因组的恢复效率。与已知参考基因组存在差异的标记基因序列可以被进一步优先考虑，这为恢复高度新型基因组提供了一种高效手段。将 Bin Chicken 应用于公共宏基因组数据并对800个样本组进行共组装，共恢复了77,562个微生物基因组，其中包括6个门、41个纲和24,028个物种的首个基因组代表。这些基因组扩展了生命基因组之树，并揭示了大量可供进一步研究的新型微生物谱系。通过开发宏基因组共组装策略并优先考虑差异性标记基因序列，Bin Chicken 高效恢复了超过77,000个具有高度新颖多样性的微生物基因组，从而扩展了生命之树。

AI & Computational Biology.title: An ancient recombination desert is a speciation supergene in placental mammals
AI & Computational Biology.summary: Nature, Published online: 12 November 2025;doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09740-2Deep learning methods identified a large and evolutionarily conserved X-linked low recombination region in placental mammals that serves as both a barrier to gene flow in hybridizing lineages and an accurate phylogenomic marker.
AI & Computational Biology.abstract: Gene flow between biological species is a common and often adaptive evolutionary phenomenon throughout the tree of life1–4. Given the pervasive nature of genetic exchange, a daunting challenge is how best to infer the correct relationships between species from the complex collection of histories arrayed across genomes5. The local rate of meiotic recombination influences the distribution of signatures of, and barriers to, gene flow during the early stages of speciation6. Still, a broader understanding of this relationship and its application to accurately discerning phylogeny is lacking due to a scarcity of recombination maps. Here we applied deep learning methods to genome alignments from 22 divergent placental mammal species to infer the evolution of the recombination landscape. We identified a large and evolutionarily conserved X-linked recombination desert constituting 30% of the chromosome. Recombination-aware phylogenomic analyses from 94 species revealed that the X-linked recombination desert is an ancient and recurrent barrier to gene flow and retains the species history when introgression dominates genome-wide ancestry. The functional basis for this supergene is manifold, enriched with genes that influence sex chromosome silencing and reproduction traits. Because the locus underpins reproductive isolation across ordinal lineages, it may represent a reliable marker for resolving challenging relationships across the mammalian phylogeny. Deep learning methods identified a large and evolutionarily conserved X-linked low recombination region in placental mammals that serves as both a barrier to gene flow in hybridizing lineages and an accurate phylogenomic marker.
AI & Computational Biology.authors_short: Foley, Nicole M. et al., Murphy, William J.
AI & Computational Biology.title_cn: 胎盘哺乳动物中一个古老的重组荒漠是物种形成的超级基因
AI & Computational Biology.abstract_cn: 生物物种间的基因流是生命之树中普遍存在的、且通常具有适应性的进化现象1–4。鉴于遗传交换的普遍性，一个艰巨的挑战是如何从基因组中复杂的历史集合中，最佳地推断物种间的正确关系5。减数分裂重组的局部速率影响着物种形成早期基因流的特征分布及其屏障6。然而，由于重组图谱的稀缺，对这种关系及其在准确识别系统发育中的应用仍缺乏更广泛的理解。本研究中，我们应用深度学习方法分析了来自22种不同胎盘哺乳动物的基因组比对数据，以推断重组图景的演化。我们识别出一个大型且进化上保守的X染色体连锁重组荒漠，其构成了该染色体的30%。对94个物种进行的重组感知系统基因组分析揭示，该X染色体连锁重组荒漠是一个古老且反复出现的基因流屏障，并在基因渗入主导全基因组祖先时保留了物种历史。这个超级基因的功能基础是多方面的，富含影响性染色体沉默和生殖性状的基因。由于该基因座支撑着跨目谱系的生殖隔离，它可能代表了一个可靠的标记，用于解决哺乳动物系统发育中具有挑战性的关系。深度学习方法在胎盘哺乳动物中识别出一个大型且进化上保守的X染色体连锁低重组区域，该区域既是杂交谱系中基因流的屏障，也是一个准确的系统基因组标记。

AI & Computational Biology.title: Aligning machine and human visual representations across abstraction levels
AI & Computational Biology.summary: Nature, Published online: 12 November 2025;doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09631-6Aligning foundation models with human judgments enables them to more accurately approximate human behaviour and uncertainty across various levels of visual abstraction, while additionally improving their generalization performance.
AI & Computational Biology.abstract: Deep neural networks have achieved success across a wide range of applications, including as models of human behaviour and neural representations in vision tasks1,2. However, neural network training and human learning differ in fundamental ways, and neural networks often fail to generalize as robustly as humans do3,4, raising questions regarding the similarity of their underlying representations. We need to determine what is missing for modern learning systems to exhibit more human-aligned behaviour. Here we highlight a key misalignment between vision models and humans: whereas human conceptual knowledge is hierarchically organized from fine- to coarse-scale distinctions (for example, ref. 5), model representations do not accurately capture all these levels of abstraction. To address this misalignment, we first train a teacher model to imitate human judgements, then transfer human-aligned structure from its representations to refine the representations of pretrained state-of-the-art vision foundation models via fine-tuning. These human-aligned models more accurately approximate human behaviour and uncertainty across a wide range of similarity tasks, including a dataset of human judgements spanning multiple levels of semantic abstractions. They also perform better on a diverse set of machine learning tasks, increasing generalization and out-of-distribution robustness. Thus, infusing neural networks with additional human knowledge yields a best-of-both-worlds representation that is both more consistent with human cognitive judgements and more practically useful, paving the way towards more robust, interpretable and human-aligned artificial intelligence systems. Aligning foundation models with human judgments enables them to more accurately approximate human behaviour and uncertainty across various levels of visual abstraction, while additionally improving their generalization performance.
AI & Computational Biology.authors_short: Muttenthaler, Lukas et al., Lampinen, Andrew K.
AI & Computational Biology.title_cn: 跨抽象层级对齐机器与人类视觉表征
AI & Computational Biology.abstract_cn: 深度神经网络已在广泛应用中取得成功，包括作为视觉任务中人类行为和神经表征的模型。然而，神经网络训练与人类学习在根本上存在差异，且神经网络在泛化能力上往往不如人类鲁棒，这引发了对其底层表征相似性的质疑。我们需要确定现代学习系统要展现出更符合人类的行为还缺少什么。在此，我们强调了视觉模型与人类之间的一个关键错位：人类概念知识是按从精细到粗略的区分（例如，参考文献5）分层组织的，而模型表征未能准确捕捉所有这些抽象层次。为解决这一错位，我们首先训练一个教师模型来模仿人类判断，然后通过微调，将其表征中与人类对齐的结构迁移到预训练的SOTA视觉基础模型中，以优化其表征。这些与人类对齐的模型在广泛的相似性任务中，包括一个涵盖多个语义抽象层次的人类判断数据集，能更准确地模拟人类行为和不确定性。它们还在多样化的机器学习任务中表现更佳，提高了泛化能力和分布外鲁棒性。因此，将额外的人类知识注入神经网络，能够产生一种兼具优势的表征，它既更符合人类认知判断，又更具实际应用价值，为构建更鲁棒、可解释和与人类对齐的人工智能系统铺平了道路。将基础模型与人类判断对齐，使其能够更准确地模拟人类在不同视觉抽象层次上的行为和不确定性，同时还能提高其泛化性能。

AI & Computational Biology.title: GREGoR: accelerating genomics for rare diseases
AI & Computational Biology.summary: Nature, Published online: 12 November 2025;doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09613-8The GREGoR consortium provides foundational resources and substrates for the future of rare disease genomics.
AI & Computational Biology.abstract: Rare diseases are collectively common, affecting approximately 1 in 20 individuals worldwide. In recent years, rapid progress has been made in rare disease diagnostics due to advances in next-generation sequencing, development of new computational and functional genomics approaches to prioritize genes and variants and increased global sharing of clinical and genetic data. However, more than half of individuals suspected to have a rare disease lack a genetic diagnosis. The Genomics Research to Elucidate the Genetics of Rare Diseases (GREGoR) Consortium was initiated to study thousands of challenging rare disease cases and families and apply, standardize and evaluate emerging genomics technologies and analytics to accelerate their adoption in clinical practice. Furthermore, all data generated, currently representing over 7,500 individuals from over 3,000 families, are rapidly made available to researchers worldwide through the Analysis, Visualization and Informatics Lab-space (AnVIL) to catalyse global efforts to develop approaches for genetic diagnoses in rare diseases. Most of these families have undergone previous clinical genetic testing but remained unsolved, with most being exome-negative. Here we describe the collaborative research framework, datasets and discoveries comprising GREGoR that will provide foundational resources and substrates for the future of rare disease genomics. The GREGoR consortium provides foundational resources and substrates for the future of rare disease genomics.
AI & Computational Biology.authors_short: Dawood, Moez et al., Montgomery, Stephen B.
AI & Computational Biology.title_cn: GREGoR：加速罕见病基因组学研究
AI & Computational Biology.abstract_cn: 罕见病总体而言并不少见，全球约每20人中就有1人受其影响。近年来，由于新一代测序技术的进步、用于优先排序基因和变异的新型计算和功能基因组学方法的发展，以及临床和遗传数据全球共享的增加，罕见病诊断取得了快速进展。然而，超过一半的疑似罕见病患者仍缺乏基因诊断。基因组学研究阐明罕见病遗传学（GREGoR）联盟的成立旨在研究数千例具有挑战性的罕见病病例和家系，并应用、标准化和评估新兴基因组学技术和分析方法，以加速其在临床实践中的应用。此外，所有生成的数据（目前代表来自3000多个家系的7500多名个体）通过分析、可视化和信息学实验室空间（AnVIL）迅速向全球研究人员开放，以促进全球在罕见病基因诊断方法开发方面的努力。这些家系中的大多数此前已接受过临床基因检测，但仍未获得明确诊断，其中大部分为外显子组阴性。本文描述了GREGoR的协作研究框架、数据集和发现，这些将为罕见病基因组学的未来提供基础资源和基石。GREGoR联盟为罕见病基因组学的未来提供了基础资源和基石。

AI & Computational Biology.title: Convolutional architectures are cortex-aligned de novo
AI & Computational Biology.summary: Nature Machine Intelligence, Published online: 13 November 2025;doi:10.1038/s42256-025-01142-3Kazemian et al. report that untrained convolutional networks with wide layers predict primate visual cortex responses nearly as well as task-optimized networks, revealing how architectural constraints shape brain-like representations in deep networks.
AI & Computational Biology.abstract: What underlies the emergence of cortex-aligned representations in deep neural network models of vision? Earlier work suggested that shared architectural constraints were a major factor, but the success of widely varied architectures after pretraining raises critical questions about the importance of architectural constraints. Here we show that in wide networks with minimal training, architectural inductive biases have a prominent role. We examined networks with varied architectures but no pretraining and quantified their ability to predict image representations in the visual cortices of monkeys and humans. We found that cortex-aligned representations emerge in convolutional architectures that combine two key manipulations of dimensionality: compression in the spatial domain, through pooling, and expansion in the feature domain by increasing the number of channels. We further show that the inductive biases of convolutional architectures are critical for obtaining performance gains from feature expansion—dimensionality manipulations were relatively ineffective in other architectures and in convolutional models with targeted lesions. Our findings suggest that the architectural constraints of convolutional networks are sufficiently close to the constraints of biological vision to allow many aspects of cortical visual representation to emerge even before synaptic connections have been tuned through experience. Kazemian et al. report that untrained convolutional networks with wide layers predict primate visual cortex responses nearly as well as task-optimized networks, revealing how architectural constraints shape brain-like representations in deep networks.
AI & Computational Biology.authors_short: Kazemian, Atlas et al., Bonner, Michael F.
AI & Computational Biology.title_cn: 卷积架构的皮层对齐是其固有的
AI & Computational Biology.abstract_cn: 视觉深度神经网络模型中与皮层对齐的表征是如何产生的？此前研究表明，共享的架构约束是一个主要因素，但预训练后各种架构的成功引发了对架构约束重要性的质疑。本研究表明，在经过最少训练的宽网络中，架构归纳偏置发挥着重要作用。我们考察了具有不同架构但未经预训练的网络，并量化了它们预测猴子和人类视觉皮层图像表征的能力。我们发现，与皮层对齐的表征出现在卷积架构中，这些架构结合了维度操作的两个关键方面：通过池化在空间域进行压缩，以及通过增加通道数在特征域进行扩展。我们进一步表明，卷积架构的归纳偏置对于从特征扩展中获得性能提升至关重要——维度操作在其他架构以及经过靶向损伤的卷积模型中相对无效。我们的研究结果表明，卷积网络的架构约束与生物视觉的约束足够接近，使得皮层视觉表征的许多方面甚至在突触连接通过经验调整之前就能出现。Kazemian 等人报告称，未经训练的宽层卷积网络预测灵长类动物视觉皮层反应的能力几乎与任务优化的网络相当，揭示了架构约束如何在深度网络中塑造类脑表征。

AI & Computational Biology.title: Solving sparse finite element problems on neuromorphic hardware
AI & Computational Biology.summary: Nature Machine Intelligence, Published online: 13 November 2025;doi:10.1038/s42256-025-01143-2Theilman and Aimone introduce a natively spiking algorithm for solving partial differential equations on large-scale neuromorphic computers and demonstrate the algorithm on Intel’s Loihi 2 neuromorphic research chip.
AI & Computational Biology.abstract: The finite element method (FEM) is one of the most important and ubiquitous numerical methods for solving partial differential equations (PDEs) on computers for scientific and engineering discovery. Applying the FEM to larger and more detailed scientific models has driven advances in high-performance computing for decades. Here we demonstrate that scalable spiking neuromorphic hardware can directly implement the FEM by constructing a spiking neural network that solves the large, sparse, linear systems of equations at the core of the FEM. We show that for the Poisson equation, a fundamental PDE in science and engineering, our neural circuit achieves meaningful levels of numerical accuracy and close to ideal scaling on modern, inherently parallel and energy-efficient neuromorphic hardware, specifically Intel’s Loihi 2 neuromorphic platform. We illustrate extensions to irregular mesh geometries in both two and three dimensions as well as other PDEs such as linear elasticity. Our spiking neural network is constructed from a recurrent network model of the brain’s motor cortex and, in contrast to black-box deep artificial neural network-based methods for PDEs, directly translates the well-understood and trusted mathematics of the FEM to a natively spiking neuromorphic algorithm. Theilman and Aimone introduce a natively spiking algorithm for solving partial differential equations on large-scale neuromorphic computers and demonstrate the algorithm on Intel’s Loihi 2 neuromorphic research chip.
AI & Computational Biology.authors_short: Theilman, Bradley H. & Aimone, James B.
AI & Computational Biology.title_cn: 在神经拟态硬件上求解稀疏有限元问题
AI & Computational Biology.abstract_cn: 有限元方法 (FEM) 是科学和工程探索中，用于在计算机上求解偏微分方程 (PDE) 的最重要和最普遍的数值方法之一。几十年来，将有限元方法应用于更大、更详细的科学模型，推动了高性能计算的发展。本文证明，可扩展的脉冲神经拟态硬件可以通过构建一个脉冲神经网络来直接实现有限元方法，该网络能够求解有限元方法核心的大型稀疏线性方程组。我们展示了，对于科学和工程中的基本偏微分方程——泊松方程，我们的神经电路在现代、固有的并行且节能的神经拟态硬件（特别是英特尔的Loihi 2神经拟态平台）上，实现了有意义的数值精度和接近理想的扩展性。我们还展示了其在二维和三维不规则网格几何以及其他偏微分方程（如线性弹性）中的扩展应用。我们的脉冲神经网络是基于大脑运动皮层的循环网络模型构建的，与基于黑盒深度人工神经网络的偏微分方程求解方法不同，它将有限元方法成熟且可靠的数学原理直接转化为一种原生的脉冲神经拟态算法。Theilman和Aimone介绍了一种用于在大规模神经拟态计算机上求解偏微分方程的原生脉冲算法，并在英特尔的Loihi 2神经拟态研究芯片上进行了演示。

AI & Computational Biology.title: SynGFN: learning across chemical space with generative flow-based molecular discovery
AI & Computational Biology.summary: Nature Computational Science, Published online: 13 November 2025;doi:10.1038/s43588-025-00902-wA persistent gap from theoretical molecules to experimentally viable compounds has hindered the practical adoption of generative algorithms. This study proposes SynGFN as a bridge linking molecular design and synthesis, accelerating exploration and producing diverse, synthesizable, high-performance molecules.
AI & Computational Biology.abstract: In recent years, artificial intelligence has advanced the design–make–test–analyze cycle, transforming molecular discovery. Despite these advances, the compartmentalized approach to computer-aided molecular design and synthesis remains a critical bottleneck, limiting further optimization of the design–make–test–analyze cycle. Here, to this end, we introduce SynGFN, which models molecular design as a cascade of simulated chemical reactions, enabling the assembly of molecules from synthesizable building blocks. SynGFN features two key ingredients: (1) a hierarchically pretrained policy network that accelerates learning across diverse distributions of desirable molecules in chemical spaces, and (2) a multifidelity acquisition framework to alleviate the cost of reward evaluations. These technical developments collectively endow SynGFN with the capability to explore a chemical space up to an order of magnitude larger (measured in terms of #Circles) than that of other synthesis-aware generative models, while identifying the most diverse, synthesizable and high-performance molecules. We demonstrate SynGFN’s potential impacts by designing inhibitors for GluN1/GluN3A, a therapeutic target for neuropsychiatric disorders. A persistent gap from theoretical molecules to experimentally viable compounds has hindered the practical adoption of generative algorithms. This study proposes SynGFN as a bridge linking molecular design and synthesis, accelerating exploration and producing diverse, synthesizable, high-performance molecules.
AI & Computational Biology.authors_short: Zhu, Yuchen et al., Hsieh, Chang-Yu
AI & Computational Biology.title_cn: SynGFN：基于生成流的分子发现，实现跨化学空间学习
AI & Computational Biology.abstract_cn: 近年来，人工智能推动了“设计-合成-测试-分析”循环的发展，从而革新了分子发现领域。尽管取得了这些进展，但计算机辅助分子设计和合成的割裂方法仍然是一个关键瓶颈，限制了“设计-合成-测试-分析”循环的进一步优化。为此，我们引入了SynGFN，它将分子设计建模为一系列模拟化学反应，从而能够从可合成的构建块组装分子。SynGFN具有两个关键要素：(1) 一个分层预训练的策略网络，可加速在化学空间中多样化理想分子分布上的学习；(2) 一个多保真度采集框架，以减轻奖励评估的成本。这些技术发展共同赋予SynGFN探索比其他合成感知生成模型大一个数量级（以#Circles衡量）的化学空间的能力，同时识别出最多样化、可合成且高性能的分子。我们通过设计GluN1/GluN3A（一种神经精神疾病的治疗靶点）的抑制剂，展示了SynGFN的潜在影响。从理论分子到实验可行化合物之间长期存在的鸿沟阻碍了生成算法的实际应用。本研究提出SynGFN作为连接分子设计与合成的桥梁，加速了探索并生成了多样化、可合成且高性能的分子。

AI & Computational Biology.title: Jaxley: differentiable simulation enables large-scale training of detailed biophysical models of neural dynamics
AI & Computational Biology.summary: Nature Methods, Published online: 13 November 2025;doi:10.1038/s41592-025-02895-wJaxley is a versatile platform for biophysical modeling in neuroscience. It allows efficiently simulating large-scale biophysical models on CPUs, GPUs and TPUs. Model parameters can be optimized with gradient descent via backpropagation of error.
AI & Computational Biology.abstract: Biophysical neuron models provide insights into cellular mechanisms underlying neural computations. A central challenge has been to identify parameters of detailed biophysical models such that they match physiological measurements or perform computational tasks. Here we describe a framework for simulating biophysical models in neuroscience—Jaxley—which addresses this challenge. By making use of automatic differentiation and GPU acceleration, Jaxley enables optimizing large-scale biophysical models with gradient descent. Jaxley can learn biophysical neuron models to match voltage or two-photon calcium recordings, sometimes orders of magnitude more efficiently than previous methods. Jaxley also makes it possible to train biophysical neuron models to perform computational tasks. We train a recurrent neural network to perform working memory tasks, and a network of morphologically detailed neurons with 100,000 parameters to solve a computer vision task. Jaxley improves the ability to build large-scale data- or task-constrained biophysical models, creating opportunities for investigating the mechanisms underlying neural computations across multiple scales. Jaxley is a versatile platform for biophysical modeling in neuroscience. It allows efficiently simulating large-scale biophysical models on CPUs, GPUs and TPUs. Model parameters can be optimized with gradient descent via backpropagation of error.
AI & Computational Biology.authors_short: Deistler, Michael et al., Macke, Jakob H.
AI & Computational Biology.title_cn: Jaxley：可微分模拟赋能神经动力学详细生物物理模型的大规模训练
AI & Computational Biology.abstract_cn: 神经元生物物理模型为理解神经计算背后的细胞机制提供了深刻见解。然而，一个核心挑战是如何识别详细生物物理模型的参数，使其能够匹配生理测量数据或执行特定的计算任务。本文介绍了一个用于神经科学中生物物理模型模拟的框架——Jaxley，它旨在解决这一挑战。通过利用自动微分和GPU加速，Jaxley能够通过梯度下降优化大规模生物物理模型。Jaxley可以学习神经元生物物理模型以匹配电压或双光子钙记录，其效率有时比现有方法高出数个数量级。Jaxley还使得训练生物物理神经元模型以执行计算任务成为可能。我们训练了一个循环神经网络来执行工作记忆任务，并训练了一个包含10万个参数的形态学详细神经元网络来解决计算机视觉任务。Jaxley提升了构建大规模数据或任务约束生物物理模型的能力，为跨尺度研究神经计算的潜在机制创造了机会。Jaxley是一个多功能的神经科学生物物理建模平台，它允许在CPU、GPU和TPU上高效模拟大规模生物物理模型。模型参数可以通过误差反向传播利用梯度下降进行优化。

AI & Computational Biology.title_cn: 大型语言模型仍然难以识别错误信念

AI & Computational Biology.title: Computationally efficient meta-analysis of gene-based tests using summary statistics in large-scale genetic studies
AI & Computational Biology.summary: Nature Genetics, Published online: 12 November 2025;doi:10.1038/s41588-025-02390-0REMETA is a method for meta-analyzing gene-based associations using summary statistics, integrating with REGENIE and improving computational efficiency for large studies with many phenotypes.
AI & Computational Biology.abstract: Meta-analysis of gene-based tests using single-variant summary statistics is a powerful strategy for genetic association studies. However, current approaches require sharing the covariance matrix between variants for each study and trait of interest. For large-scale studies with many phenotypes, these matrices can be cumbersome to calculate, store and share. Here, to address this challenge, we present REMETA—an efficient tool for meta-analysis of gene-based tests. REMETA uses a single sparse covariance reference file per study that is rescaled for each phenotype using single-variant summary statistics. We develop new methods for binary traits with case–control imbalance, and to estimate allele frequencies, genotype counts and effect sizes of burden tests. We demonstrate the performance and advantages of our approach through meta-analysis of five traits in 469,376 samples in UK Biobank. The open-source REMETA software will facilitate meta-analysis across large-scale exome sequencing studies from diverse studies that cannot easily be combined. REMETA is a method for meta-analyzing gene-based associations using summary statistics, integrating with REGENIE and improving computational efficiency for large studies with many phenotypes.
AI & Computational Biology.authors_short: Joseph, Tyler A. et al., Marchini, Jonathan
AI & Computational Biology.title_cn: 大规模遗传学研究中基于汇总统计量的基因检验高效荟萃分析
AI & Computational Biology.abstract_cn: 利用单变异汇总统计量进行基于基因检验的荟萃分析是遗传关联研究的有力策略。然而，现有方法要求在每个研究和感兴趣的性状之间共享变异体间的协方差矩阵。对于具有众多表型的大规模研究，这些矩阵的计算、存储和共享可能非常繁琐。为应对这一挑战，我们在此提出REMETA——一个用于基于基因检验荟萃分析的高效工具。REMETA为每个研究使用一个稀疏协方差参考文件，该文件利用单变异汇总统计量针对每个表型进行重新缩放。我们开发了针对病例-对照不平衡的二元性状的新方法，并用于估计等位基因频率、基因型计数和负担检验的效应大小。我们通过对英国生物样本库中469,376个样本的五种性状进行荟萃分析，证明了我们方法的性能和优势。开源的REMETA软件将促进来自不同研究、难以轻易合并的大规模外显子组测序研究的荟萃分析。REMETA是一种利用汇总统计量对基于基因的关联进行荟萃分析的方法，它与REGENIE集成，并提高了具有众多表型的大规模研究的计算效率。

AI & Computational Biology.title: Olympiad-level formal mathematical reasoning with reinforcement learning
AI & Computational Biology.summary: Nature, Published online: 12 November 2025;doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09833-yOlympiad-level formal mathematical reasoning with reinforcement learning
AI & Computational Biology.abstract: A long-standing goal of artificial intelligence is to build systems capable of complex reasoning in vast domains, a task epitomized by mathematics with its boundless concepts and demand for rigorous proof. Recent AI systems, often reliant on human data, typically lack the formal verification necessary to guarantee correctness. By contrast, formal languages such as Lean1 offer an interactive environment that grounds reasoning, and reinforcement learning (RL) provides a mechanism for learning in such environments. We present AlphaProof, an AlphaZero-inspired2 agent that learns to find formal proofs through RL by training on millions of auto-formalized problems. For the most difficult problems, it uses Test-Time RL, a method of generating and learning from millions of related problem variants at inference time to enable deep, problem-specific adaptation. AlphaProof substantially improves state-of-the-art results on historical mathematics competition problems. At the 2024 IMO competition, our AI system, with AlphaProof as its core reasoning engine, solved three out of the five non-geometry problems, including the competition’s most difficult problem. Combined with AlphaGeometry 23, this performance, achieved with multi-day computation, resulted in reaching a score equivalent to that of a silver medallist, marking the first time an AI system achieved any medal-level performance. Our work demonstrates that learning at scale from grounded experience produces agents with complex mathematical reasoning strategies, paving the way for a reliable AI tool in complex mathematical problem-solving.
AI & Computational Biology.authors_short: Hubert, Thomas et al., Silver, David
AI & Computational Biology.title_cn: 基于强化学习的奥林匹克级别形式化数学推理
AI & Computational Biology.abstract_cn: 人工智能的长期目标之一是构建能够在广阔领域进行复杂推理的系统，而数学以其无限的概念和对严谨证明的要求，正是这项任务的典型代表。近期的人工智能系统，通常依赖于人类数据，但往往缺乏确保正确性所需的正式验证。相比之下，Lean1等形式化语言提供了一个能够奠定推理基础的交互式环境，而强化学习（RL）则为在这种环境中学习提供了机制。我们提出了AlphaProof，一个受AlphaZero2启发的智能体，它通过在数百万个自动形式化问题上进行训练，利用强化学习来学习寻找形式化证明。对于最困难的问题，它采用“测试时强化学习”（Test-Time RL），这是一种在推理时生成并从数百万个相关问题变体中学习的方法，以实现深度的问题特定适应。AlphaProof显著提升了在历史数学竞赛问题上最先进的成果。在2024年国际数学奥林匹克（IMO）竞赛中，我们的AI系统以AlphaProof为核心推理引擎，解决了五个非几何问题中的三个，其中包括竞赛中最困难的问题。结合AlphaGeometry 23，这项通过多日计算实现的表现，达到了相当于银牌得主的成绩，标志着人工智能系统首次获得任何奖牌级别的表现。我们的工作表明，从扎实经验中进行大规模学习能够产生具备复杂数学推理策略的智能体，为复杂数学问题解决中的可靠人工智能工具铺平了道路。

Synthetic Biology.title: Controlling pyramidal nitrogen chirality by asymmetric organocatalysis
Synthetic Biology.summary: Nature, Published online: 12 November 2025;doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09607-6An asymmetric organocatalysis strategy is used to control pyramidal nitrogen chirality and to synthesize the enantioselective N-chloroaziridines with a configurationally stable nitrogen stereogenic centre.
Synthetic Biology.abstract: Chirality is central to life, and controlling the formation of one of a pair of mirror-image molecules (enantiomers) is a central tenet of synthetic chemistry. Although controlling stereogenic carbon1–3, silicon4,5, phosphorus6,7 and sulfur8,9 centres is commonplace, nitrogen centres in amines are not typically stable. Limited achievements in the enantioselective construction of nitrogen chirality have primarily been established in quaternary ammonium salts10–12 and bridged bicyclic amines13–17, which have a restricted pyramidal configuration. The asymmetric synthesis of non-bridged pyramidal nitrogen-chirogenic compounds suffers from a super-stoichiometric chiral source and exhibits poor stereoselectivity18–24. Here we present a catalytic enantioselective strategy for construction of acyclic nitrogen stereocentres via a chiral Brønsted acid-catalysed chlorination reaction. We designed a stereospecific intramolecular reaction to overcome the structural and configurational instabilities of nitrogen-chlorinated hydroxylamines. The resulting 2-alkoxy-1,2-oxazolidines showed good enantiopurities, and density functional theory calculations confirmed successful enantiocontrol of nitrogen chirality during the chlorination process. Furthermore, this strategy has been applied successfully to synthesize the enantioselective N-chloroaziridines with a configurationally stable nitrogen stereogenic centre. Control experiments provide evidence for an SN2 pathway for the intramolecular nucleophilic substitution event. An asymmetric organocatalysis strategy is used to control pyramidal nitrogen chirality and to synthesize the enantioselective N-chloroaziridines with a configurationally stable nitrogen stereogenic centre.
Synthetic Biology.authors_short: Wu, San et al., Tan, Bin
Synthetic Biology.title_cn: 不对称有机催化实现锥形氮手性的控制
Synthetic Biology.abstract_cn: 手性是生命的核心，控制一对镜像分子（对映异构体）中一个的形成是合成化学的核心原则。尽管手性碳、硅、磷和硫中心的控制已是常见做法，但胺中的氮中心通常不稳定。在氮手性对映选择性构建方面的有限进展主要集中在季铵盐和桥联双环胺中，这些化合物具有受限的锥形构型。非桥联锥形手性氮化合物的不对称合成存在超化学计量手性源和立体选择性差的问题。本文提出了一种通过手性布朗斯特酸催化的氯化反应构建非环状氮立体中心的催化对映选择性策略。我们设计了一种立体专一的分子内反应，以克服氯代羟胺氮的结构和构型不稳定性。所得的2-烷氧基-1,2-噁唑烷表现出良好的对映纯度，密度泛函理论计算证实了氯化过程中氮手性的成功对映控制。此外，该策略已成功应用于合成具有构型稳定氮手性中心的对映选择性N-氯氮丙啶。对照实验为分子内亲核取代反应的SN2途径提供了证据。不对称有机催化策略被用于控制锥形氮手性，并合成具有构型稳定氮手性中心的对映选择性N-氯氮丙啶。

Synthetic Biology.title: Synthesis of enantioenriched atropisomers by biocatalytic deracemization
Synthetic Biology.summary: Nature, Published online: 12 November 2025;doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09738-wA new method for deracemization of atropisomers is described which leverages a P450 enzyme-mediated process involving bond rotation for enantioenrichment.
Synthetic Biology.abstract: The synthesis of enantiopure materials is vital for pharmaceutical and agrochemical industries owing to the inherently chiral nature of biological systems and the fact that two enantiomers can have markedly different biochemical properties1. In particular, enantioselective preparation of atropisomers is of great interest owing to their privileged status as chiral ligands and pharmacophores2–4. Although chromatographic- or crystallization-based methods are commonly used to separate atropisomers, we urgently need more efficient and economical approaches to access enantioenriched atropisomers5,6. The use of stereoconvergent methods to access molecules with point chirality is well established but we have not tapped the potential of stereoconvergent catalytic methods to arrive at enantioenriched atropisomers. Here we report deracemization activity of a P450 enzyme and explore its ability to deliver a stereoconvergent route towards enantioenriched atropisomers. Using a curated set of P450 variants, we found that a wide variety of symmetric and non-symmetrically substituted 2,2′-binaphthol (BINOL) building blocks can be deracemized to high enantiomeric purity. This deracemization activity is mechanistically distinct from the activity of previously reported P450 enzymes, which operate through enantioselective bond formation to afford enantioenriched atropisomers. By contrast, the deracemization process reported here is proposed to proceed through bond rotation. As engineered variants have complementary selectivity profiles and substrate scope, this biocatalytic platform should be readily tunable for any desired substitution pattern. We anticipate that these results will inspire new stereoconvergent approaches to synthesizing conformationally stable atropisomers. A new method for deracemization of atropisomers is described which leverages a P450 enzyme-mediated process involving bond rotation for enantioenrichment.
Synthetic Biology.authors_short: Roos, Casey B. et al., Narayan, Alison R. H.
Synthetic Biology.title_cn: 通过生物催化消旋化合成富对映体阻转异构体
Synthetic Biology.abstract_cn: 对映体纯材料的合成对于制药和农化工业至关重要，因为生物系统本质上是手性的，并且两种对映体可能具有显著不同的生化性质1。特别是，阻转异构体的对映选择性制备备受关注，因为它们作为手性配体和药效团具有特殊地位2-4。尽管色谱法或结晶法常用于分离阻转异构体，但我们迫切需要更高效、更经济的方法来获得富对映体阻转异构体5,6。利用立体会聚方法获得具有点手性分子已得到充分证实，但我们尚未充分发掘立体会聚催化方法在制备富对映体阻转异构体方面的潜力。在此，我们报道了一种P450酶的消旋化活性，并探索了其提供立体会聚途径以获得富对映体阻转异构体的能力。通过使用一组经过筛选的P450变体，我们发现多种对称和非对称取代的2,2′-联萘酚（BINOL）结构单元可以被消旋化，从而达到高对映体纯度。这种消旋化活性在机制上不同于先前报道的P450酶的活性，后者通过对映选择性键形成来提供富对映体阻转异构体。相比之下，本文报道的消旋化过程被认为是通过键旋转进行的。由于工程化变体具有互补的选择性谱和底物范围，因此该生物催化平台应能针对任何所需的取代模式进行轻松调节。我们预计这些结果将启发新的立体会聚方法来合成构象稳定的阻转异构体。本文描述了一种阻转异构体消旋化的新方法，该方法利用P450酶介导的涉及键旋转的过程来实现对映体富集。

Molecular Design.title: Controlling pyramidal nitrogen chirality by asymmetric organocatalysis
Molecular Design.summary: Nature, Published online: 12 November 2025;doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09607-6An asymmetric organocatalysis strategy is used to control pyramidal nitrogen chirality and to synthesize the enantioselective N-chloroaziridines with a configurationally stable nitrogen stereogenic centre.
Molecular Design.abstract: Chirality is central to life, and controlling the formation of one of a pair of mirror-image molecules (enantiomers) is a central tenet of synthetic chemistry. Although controlling stereogenic carbon1–3, silicon4,5, phosphorus6,7 and sulfur8,9 centres is commonplace, nitrogen centres in amines are not typically stable. Limited achievements in the enantioselective construction of nitrogen chirality have primarily been established in quaternary ammonium salts10–12 and bridged bicyclic amines13–17, which have a restricted pyramidal configuration. The asymmetric synthesis of non-bridged pyramidal nitrogen-chirogenic compounds suffers from a super-stoichiometric chiral source and exhibits poor stereoselectivity18–24. Here we present a catalytic enantioselective strategy for construction of acyclic nitrogen stereocentres via a chiral Brønsted acid-catalysed chlorination reaction. We designed a stereospecific intramolecular reaction to overcome the structural and configurational instabilities of nitrogen-chlorinated hydroxylamines. The resulting 2-alkoxy-1,2-oxazolidines showed good enantiopurities, and density functional theory calculations confirmed successful enantiocontrol of nitrogen chirality during the chlorination process. Furthermore, this strategy has been applied successfully to synthesize the enantioselective N-chloroaziridines with a configurationally stable nitrogen stereogenic centre. Control experiments provide evidence for an SN2 pathway for the intramolecular nucleophilic substitution event. An asymmetric organocatalysis strategy is used to control pyramidal nitrogen chirality and to synthesize the enantioselective N-chloroaziridines with a configurationally stable nitrogen stereogenic centre.
